title: Aurelion sol lore question!
body: In sol's story he senses a void creature that is extremely powerful and intelligent, was the identity of this being ever addressed by riot?

replies.body:
Hm. There's not much that I can say about this as we write bios and stories to contain further story hooks. In some cases, we have hinted towards things that are in development for a future release, but in the case of the Void being Aurelion Sol senses, it isn't something we've been actively working on. It was more there to put Aurelion Sol in perspective -- that there are things that could give a star-forging ageless dragon pause and make it shudder. In other words: there are entities that would give him a fight, that he might not be able to understand, or that he believes could pose a threat. 

So far, our celestial pantheon is still growing. It's one of my favorite areas of Runeterra to write for. Hope I get to do some more stuff there soon.

How big do you plan on making space lore? The old lore had several champions coming from different planets and dimensions, with the retcons placing them on Runeterra. Now, we have space dragons, constellation people, and Void being pseudo-aliens. Will we ever explore other planets?

> [{quoted}](name=Chromatic Eagle,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=an0tIlvm,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2016-12-19T21:48:22.546+0000)
>
> How big do you plan on making space lore? The old lore had several champions coming from different planets and dimensions, with the retcons placing them on Runeterra. Now, we have space dragons, constellation people, and Void being pseudo-aliens. Will we ever explore other planets?

We're all very focused on Runeterra and the goings on there. I don't know that we will explore all of the massive cosmos unless there's a really good story reason to do so, or unless it's seen through the eyes of those bound to Runeterra. 

I won't say never, but right now, it's not the focus.
Thank you very much, though its not something in progress , its still exciting to know there are forces we have yet to see and are possible to contend with our cosmic dragon.

CanÂ´t they just rework Cho into a being that would fit that description? When I think about Cho I feel like they could do SO MUCH MORE with him, his title is Terror of the Void, right now we got more like the Gooflord of the Void

I feel like Cho shouldn't start out that way though.
After all Cho grows the more he eats,so he should start out a bit smaller and then grow to become this huge monster.
Sol "shuttered at the thought of entity that was capable of inducing such a volatile rift", this seems to be on a bigger scale then the current void champs we have.

I made a video on my channel that i might or might not bring back to life about this topic: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a1enEDf-s7E

I think it's going to be revealed as Cho'Gath once his bio gets updated since his old bio is retconned.

Watched your video and there are good points to it. As much as I'd rather it not be Cho'gath, he does seem like a very strong pick based on personality and what is said about him. 

My issue with it being Cho'gath is that the creature created a rift between dimensions, one unlike Sol has seen before. Cho is not known to have this ability and though Cho is powerful, do we really want him to be the "top dog" of the void? Cho has said that daylight hurts him, this would be a very short battle for Sol.

I may be looking to much into this and my idea of what the void could be may be a little much. I'd just like to see something more complex then a monster that grows bigger after it had a snack. This creature doesn't have to be a supreme ruler, just make it "one of the greats" , ya know?
Not currently. Right now there's scarce lore to go on about the void, but whatever it is it's probably phenomenally powerful and extremely dangerous to Runeterra, and the universe.
Thanks for replying! This is interesting, seems like a new void champ is in the distant future.
